Accused of sharing information with a 'Himalayan yogi', the court said that no grounds were made out to grant anticipatory bail to Ramkrishna. It is reported that the CBI argued against granting protection to her.

174.title: India declare at 574/8 against Sri Lanka with Ravindra Jadeja not out on 175
174.article_body: India declared their first innings in the first Test at 574/8 with all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja batting at 175*(228). Jadeja and Mohammad Shami shared an unbeaten ninth-wicket partnership of 103 runs. Rishabh Pant, Ravichandran Ashwin and Hanuma Vihari scored fifties for India, while Virat Kohli, playing in his 100th Test, registered 45(76) in the first innings.

175.title: BJP seeks votes on the basis of lies: Rahul Gandhi
175.article_body: Addressing a rally in Varanasi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday attacked PM Modi and said he claims to protect Hinduism but he protects lies. "I respect you all enough to never lie on your faces. They (Bharatiya Janata Party) do not seek votes on the name of the Hindu religion, but on the basis of lies," he said.

176.title: Local BJP leader held in Chhattisgarh for assaulting journalist in Durg
176.article_body: Police arrested a local BJP leader in Chhattisgarh for allegedly assaulting a journalist, identified as Dhirendra Giri Goswami, in the Durg district. The alleged assault took place in a colony under the Amleshwar Police Station area on Thursday night, police said. "Some unidentified person hit Goswami on his head with a sharp-edged weapon and injured him," the FIR states.

177.title: Man held for blackmailing woman with nude photos, videos in B'luru
177.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly blackmailing women with their nude selfie videos and photos in Bengaluru. As per police, the accused would give missed calls to women and trap them into a relationship by talking sweet once they called him back. He would then film their intimate moments and blackmail them for money.

178.title: Crime reporter killed in Mexico; 7th to be murdered this year
178.article_body: A crime reporter was shot and killed in Mexico's Zacatecas on Friday, officials said. Juan Muniz, who also worked as a taxi driver, was reportedly shot in the head while driving passengers. Zacatecas' Governor, David Monreal, condemned the killing and asked police to "find those guilty as quickly as possible". So far, seven media workers have been killed in Mexico.

179.title: 11 Pune hospitals owe ₹12 lakh to 25 COVID-19 patients; PMC issues notices
179.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has issued show-cause notices to at least 11 private hospitals in the city for not refunding the excess amount charged to COVID-19 patients. According to officials, at least 25 patients have to be reimbursed over ₹12 lakh. These bills were audited by the civic body for patients admitted between May and November last year.

180.title: Australia defeat defending champions England in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener
180.article_body: Australia defeated defending champions England by 12 runs in their first match at 2022 Women's World Cup. Australia opener Rachael Haynes scored her career-best 130 runs off 131 deliveries to help her team post a total of 310/3. Alana King picked up three wickets, while Tahila McGrath took two wickets as England were restricted to 298/8 in their 50 overs.

181.title: PayPal shuts services in Russia, condemns it for violent aggression
181.article_body: US-based payments company PayPal has announced that it has shut down its services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. PayPal CEO said the firm "stands with the international community in condemning Russia's violent military aggression in Ukraine". PayPal had stopped accepting new users in the country on Wednesday. It will support withdrawals "for a period of time".

182.title: Will challenge EC in SC over fund payment before Manipur polls: Cong
182.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accused Election Commission of helping BJP in the Manipur polls and said that he will file a petition in the Supreme Court challenging the EC's decision. He opposed EC's decision of not considering BJP-led Manipur government's payment of funds to the banned militant groups before the state polls as violation of Model Code of Conduct.

183.title: Mumbai doctor trying to recharge OTT platform loses ₹1.80 lakh to cyber fraudster
183.article_body: A doctor from Mumbai lost ₹1.80 lakh to a cyber fraudster while trying to recharge an OTT platform. Police said the victim received a reminder email from an unknown email address when the OTT platform's recharge period expired. She clicked on a link and was asked to fill in her bank details and OTP, following which she lost the money.

184.title: Shane Warne condemned Russia's attack on Ukraine as 'unjustified' days before demise
184.article_body: Days before his demise, former Australian cricketer Shane Warne criticised Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it an "unprovoked and unjustified" attack in a tweet. "The pictures are horrific and I can't believe more is not being done to stop this," he wrote. Tagging Ukrainian football manager Andriy Shevchenko, Warne said, "Sending lots of love to my Ukrainian mate...and his family."

185.title: If you were friends with Warne, they didn't sledge: Kumble on Australia's 'untold secret'
185.article_body: Recalling an "untold secret" of Australian team involving Shane Warne, Anil Kumble said, "When you went out to bat...and if you were friends with Warne, you didn't get any banter from the Australians." Kumble added, "So when I went to bat...Aussies didn't need to do any banter to unsettle me. That was Warnie...that was how he looked after his friends."

186.title: Mumbai Monorail to be linked with Colaba-Seepz Metro-3 line at Mahalaxmi
186.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is planning to connect the Mumbai Monorail corridor with the Colaba-Seepz underground Metro-3 line. According to reports, the Chembur-Jacob Circle Monorail corridor will be extended by about 500 metres to link it with Mahalaxmi Metro Station. The extension is expected to improve the connectivity in Mahalaxmi, Parel and Wadala areas.

187.title: Govt proposes 10% tree cover for residential, commercial construction sites
187.article_body: The Centre has proposed that at least one tree be planted in every 80 square metres of land in order to ensure residential and commercial construction sites have at least 10% of their area under green cover. The draft rules will apply to old as well as new buildings having a built-up area of or greater than 5,000 square metres.

188.title: Who is Alex, the Russian entrepreneur behind 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Putin?
188.article_body: Russian entrepreneur Alex Konanykhin, whose 'Wanted: dead or alive' post on Russian President Vladimir Putin went viral, moved to the US in 1992 with his family. Alex, whom Russia had accused of embezzling money, is a former banker who now heads several technology companies. His company's website claims he established Russia's largest bank by the age of 25.

189.title: Singapore sanctions 4 Russian banks; bans military goods, computers export
189.article_body: Singapore announced sanctions against Russia over its "unprovoked attack" on Ukraine, becoming one of the few Southeast Asian nations to do so. It includes a ban on dealing with four Russian banks and an export ban on electronics, computers and military items. The sanctions "aim to constrain Russia's capacity to conduct war" and engage in "cyber aggression", Foreign Ministry said.

190.title: Jadeja breaks record for highest-ever Test score by an Indian batting at no. 7
190.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has broken the record for registering the highest Test score by an Indian batting at number seven. Jadeja achieved the feat after reaching 168 runs with a six in India's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka. The previous record was set by Kapil Dev, who scored 163 runs against Sri Lanka in 1986.

191.title: Aditya Thackeray inaugurates AkshyaChaitanya kitchen; to serve 6,500 kids
191.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aditya Thackeray inaugurated the AkshyaChaitanya kitchen on Friday. Located in Byculla, this kitchen will serve nutritious breakfast every day to more than 6,500 school kids in BMC schools and 1,800 meals to families of patients in various Govt hospitals in Mumbai. "We will scale this service up, to serve all schools with nutritious breakfast," Thackeray said.

192.title: Remove late CM Arjun Singh's statue from road in Bhopal: HC to MP govt
192.article_body: Madhya Pradesh HC ordered the state government to remove late CM Arjun Singh's statue from a trijunction in Bhopal. It also ordered the removal of all statues in public utility places erected since January 18, 2013. A petition had argued that Singh's statue was erected at the place where a statue of freedom fighter Chandrashekhar Azad earlier stood.

193.title: Was offered cop roles, negative roles due to my short hair: Mandira
193.article_body: Mandira Bedi revealed that she was offered "at least 10 cop roles" and "at least 5-6 negative roles" because of her short hair. "Just think about it, either...cop or...negative character...Now, people cast me to play...strong modern woman so short hair means a lot of things," Mandira said, adding, "I like short hair...and I'll keep it as long as I want."

194.title: Indian politicians mourn demise of legendary spinner Shane Warne
194.article_body: Several Indian politicians including NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Union minister Nitin Gadkari and Congress leader Sachin Pilot mourned the demise of Australian spin legend Shane Warne. Pawar, who was the ICC President from 2010 to 2012, said, "The world today has lost one of the greatest cricketing heroes of all time." Pilot called Warne "a true performer and entertainer".

195.title: Meta pauses all ads in Russia, blocks Russian advertisers globally
195.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has paused all ads in Russia and blocked Russian advertisers from running ads anywhere in the world amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Due to the difficulties of operating in Russia at this time, ads targeting people in Russia will be paused," the company said. Earlier, Russia blocked Facebook, citing 26 cases of "discrimination against Russian media".

196.title: School girl raped & forced to take poison by senior, dies in UP
196.article_body: A 16-year-old Dalit girl has died after she was allegedly raped and later forced to consume poison by a senior at her school in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. According to the police, the deceased was lured by the senior under the pretext of buying her gifts. The girl was reportedly found in a field in a semi-naked and unconscious state.

197.title: I'm just crying, can start crying from nothing: Ukrainian footballer Zinchenko
197.article_body: Sharing the impact of the Russian invasion of Ukraine on him, Manchester City's Ukrainian footballer Oleksandr Zinchenko said he is just crying and can start crying from "nothing". "I'll be honest, if not for my...family, I would be there," added Zinchenko. "I am surprised that not one Russian top footballer has said anything. They just ignore it," stated Zinchenko.

198.title: Russian economy headed for deep recession, may face 1998-like crisis: JPMorgan
198.article_body: JPMorgan & Chase's economists said the Russian economy "now looks headed for a deep recession" following sanctions by Western countries. They expect Russia's GDP to contract 7% this year as compared to a 5.3% contraction in the 1998 debt crisis. A peak-to trough decline in Russian GDP is now expected "at around 12%, comparable to 1998 (~10%) crisis", economists added.

199.title: China sets lowest GDP growth target in over 30 years at 5.5%
199.article_body: World's second largest economy China has set a GDP growth target of around 5.5% this year, the slowest pace in more than three decades. Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said in his government work report, "Our country will encounter many more risks and challenges." The country will spend 7.1% more on defence this year, outpacing the government's economic growth forecast.

200.title: Rodney set standards for wicketkeeping at unattainable level: Kapil Dev
200.article_body: Kapil Dev took to Instagram to condole the demise of ex-Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh and Shane Warne, stating that Rodney set the standards for wicketkeeping at an almost unattainable level. "Shane, you lived your life king size," added Kapil in his post. "Stunned and miserable. Will miss you Warnie. Will...treasure our on field duels," read a tweet from Sachin Tendulkar.

201.title: Container truck crashes into houses in Maha; residents narrowly escape
201.article_body: Residents had a narrow escape after an overspeeding container truck crashed into two houses and a shop in Maharashtra's Kolad along the Mumbai-Goa Highway. "The container went at least 10 feet inside and caused major structural damage to both the houses and the shop," a police official said. The driver was injured and is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

202.title: Mobile phone theft leads to shootout with Delhi Police, 2 held
202.article_body: Two men have been arrested for allegedly snatching a man's mobile phone and firing at the police in Delhi. The police laid a trap to catch the suspects, who earlier managed to escape after snatching a mobile phone. The suspects fired on police after getting trapped and during return fire, one got injured. Both were arrested after the shootout.

203.title: Gujarat shopkeeper chokes girl to death, attempts suicide in hotel room
203.article_body: A 21-year-old shopkeeper from Gujarat's Kutch was booked for allegedly choking a girl to death using packaging tape inside a hotel room in Rajkot. Later, the accused attempted suicide before he was rushed to a hospital, where his condition is stated to be critical. "Apparently, the couple was into some relationship, but somehow things went awry," an officer said.

204.title: Tesla German Gigafactory gets conditional approval for production
204.article_body: Tesla's Gigafactory near Berlin has received a conditional go-ahead, ending months of delay. However, Tesla cannot start production right away. The licence is subject to a public objection period as well as other final inspection conditions that include air pollution control and water usage. Tesla intends to produce up to 5,00,000 vehicles per year at the plant.

205.title: Russia declares ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors
205.article_body: Russia has declared ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors for civilians. Russian military said it is halting its offensive so residents can leave Mariupol and Volnovakha. Following the second round of negotiations between the two countries, a Ukrainian official had said that Russia agreed on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians.

206.title: Thai man jailed for putting a sticker on King's portrait during protest
206.article_body: A court in Thailand on Friday sentenced a 33-year-old man to two years in prison for insulting the monarchy, his lawyers said. Narin Kulpongsathorn was allegedly found guilty of putting a sticker bearing the logo of a political satire Facebook page on a large portrait of King Maha Vajiralongkorn outside the Supreme Court during a political rally in 2020.

207.title: 'Game of Thrones' actor John Stahl passes away aged 68
207.article_body: 'Game of Thrones' actor John Stahl has passed away aged 68, his agent said in a statement. He died on Isle of Lewis in Scotland on March 2 and is survived by his wife, Jane Paton, the statement read. John Stahl played Rickard Karstark in 'Game of Thrones' and was also known for playing Inverdarroch in 'Take The High Road'.

208.title: B'luru police file charge sheet against 11 in Bitcoin drugs case
208.article_body: Bengaluru police have filed a charge sheet against 11 people, including a hacker called 'Sriki', in a case regarding the purchase of drugs from dark web using Bitcoin. The case had brought to light other cases involving 'Sriki', like the ₹11.5 crore cybertheft from the Karnataka e-governance cell in 2019. A former MLA's son is also accused in the case.

209.title: Masked persons hurl crude bomb outside expelled BJP leader's house in Manipur
209.article_body: Two masked persons hurled a crude bomb outside the residence of expelled BJP leader Chongtham Bijoy Singh in Lamphel area of Manipur's Imphal West on Friday night, according to police. Nobody was injured in the blast triggered by the miscreants, who came in a two-wheeler vehicle, police added. "The attack might be a threat...to make me politically silent," Bijoy said.

210.title: IAF postpones Exercise Vayu Shakti 2022 to be held in Raj on March 7
210.article_body: Indian Air Force (IAF) has postponed Exercise Vayu Shakti 2022 which was scheduled to be held in Rajasthan on March 7, officials said. PM Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh were scheduled to attend the exercise, in which Rafale aircraft was slated to participate for the first time. The Defence Ministry had earlier announced postponing of DefExpo 2022.

211.title: Paragliding, balloon flights restricted ahead of PM Modi's Pune visit
211.article_body: Pune's district administration has restricted all paragliding activities and balloon flights ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the district. As per an order issued by District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh, the restriction will last till midnight on March 6. The order states that action will be taken against the violators under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code.

212.title: Shocking: SC on Punjab & Haryana HC granting protection to ex-DGP
212.article_body: Commenting on Punjab and Haryana HC order, which granted protection from arrest to former Punjab Director General of Police (DGP) Sumedh Singh Saini, Supreme Court said it was "shocked". "How can future course of action be stayed?" SC added. HC granted protection to Saini in pending cases, except Balwant Singh Multani murder case, and cases likely to be registered.

213.title: I wanted a sibling for Vir, wanted a little daughter: Mandira on adopting Tara
213.article_body: Mandira Bedi, in an interview, opened up on her decision to adopt Tara and said that she "wanted a little daughter" and a sibling for her son, Vir. "I love making her hair and putting bows in her hair and dressing her up. It feels like I've got a little doll to play with. She's so cute...and adorable," Mandira added.

214.title: N Korea fires suspected ballistic missile into sea, 9th test this year
214.article_body: North Korea on Saturday fired a suspected ballistic missile into the sea off its east coast, South Korea and Japan said. This is Pyongyang's ninth missile test so far this year. South Korean military said the projectile reached a height of 560 km and flew a distance of 270 km. The launch comes days before South Korea's Presidential election.

215.title: 2 killed in poll-related violence in Manipur as voting for Assembly elections underway
215.article_body: Two people were killed in separate incidents of poll-related violence in Manipur as voting is underway for the second and last phase of state Assembly elections on Saturday. The first incident took place in Thoubal district and the second in Senapati. The last phase of the 2022 Manipur Assembly polls has 92 candidates contesting across 22 Assembly constituencies.

216.title: What was the greatest India XI picked by Shane Warne?
216.article_body: Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, had picked greatest India XI in 2020, which included players he played against in international career. He had named Sourav Ganguly as captain and picked Virender Sehwag and Navjot Singh Sidhu as openers. Other players included Rahul Dravid, Sachin Tendulkar, Mohammed Azharuddin, Kapil Dev, Nayan Mongia, Harbhajan Singh, Anil Kumble and Javagal Srinath.

217.title: Ravindra Jadeja smashes Test hundred after over 3 years, does sword-wielding celebration
217.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed his second Test hundred after reaching the three-figure mark off 160 deliveries on the second day of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali. Jadeja did the sword-wielding celebration after reaching his hundred. His first Test hundred had come against West Indies in October 2018.

218.title: BMC allots land for 'Dabbawala Bhavan' in Bandra
218.article_body: The BMC general body approved the 'Dabbawala Bhavan' project in Bandra with Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar handing over the land to the President of Mumbai Tiffin Box Suppliers Association (Dabbawale), Ramdas Karwande. The Bhavan was first proposed by the Shiv Sena in its 2017 BMC election manifesto. However, it was kept aside due to non-availability of land in the city.

219.title: Won't do so unless at gunpoint: Elon Musk on Starlink blocking Russian news sources
219.article_body: World's richest person and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "Starlink has been told by some governments (not Ukraine) to block Russian news sources." "We will not do so unless at gunpoint. Sorry to be a free speech absolutist," he said. In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "My sympathies to the...people of Russia, who do want this (war)."

220.title: People pay respects with beers and cigarettes at Warne's statue in Australia
220.article_body: People paid their respects at the base of a statue of former Australian cricket great Shane Warne at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with flowers, beers and cigarettes. Warne passed away at the age of 52 in Thailand. "It was pretty devastating to lose a childhood hero," said a man who came to the MCG to pay his respects.

221.title: I would probably be in jail if I did that: Serena on Zverev's outburst against umpire
221.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev being thrown out of a tournament last month for smashing racquet against the umpire's chair, Serena Williams said, "There is absolutely a double standard...I'd probably be in jail if I did that." Notably, Serena was placed on probation for two years by Grand Slam committee for a "major offence of aggravated behaviour" at US Open 2009.

222.title: K'taka CM proposes freeing temples from govt control in state Budget
222.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Bommai while presenting the state Budget on Friday proposed to free temples from government control by giving autonomy to those coming under the Endowment department. "Necessary legal action will be taken to delegate the discretion of developmental works to the temples," Bommai said. A total of 34,563 temples in Karnataka comes under the Endowment Department.

223.title: 6 arrested for shooting two realtors dead on Hyderabad outskirts
223.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested six accused in connection with the murder of two realtors on the outskirts of the city. "The motive behind the realtors' murder case is land disputes," said Mahesh Bhagwat, Rachakonda Commissioner of Police. According to police, main accused, Matta Reddy, had hatched the murder conspiracy along with his watchman by procuring firearms from Bihar.

224.title: Breathalyser tests to check drunk driving resume in Gurugram after 2 years
224.article_body: After being paused due to the fear of the spread of COVID-19 in March 2020, breathalyser tests resumed to check drunk driving in Gurugram on Friday. The city police have decided to resume the tests a day after the Golf Course Road accident in which four employees of a restaurant were killed by a speeding vehicle.

225.title: Entire world will pay the price if Russia-Ukraine war continues: Rajnath Singh
225.article_body: Addressing a public rally in Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli, Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh warned if the war between Russia and Ukraine continues it'll cause more trouble. "Most nations that import oil, gas from Russia...US has imposed sanctions on Russia...If their economies are affected, the entire world will have to pay the price and India will not be spared," he said.

226.title: Medical students who returned from Ukraine can complete internship in India: NMC
226.article_body: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has said that medical students who have returned to India from Ukraine due to the war can complete their internship in India after clearing Foreign Medical Graduate Examination. "Considering the agony and stress faced by these foreign medical graduates, their application to complete the remaining part of internship in India is considered eligible," NMC added.

227.title: Relay room catches fire at Pune's Dapodi Rly Station; no one hurt
227.article_body: The relay room at Pune's Dapodi Railway Station caught fire at 7.15 pm on Friday and affected the movement of five trains on the Pune-Mumbai route for 40 minutes, according to a railway spokesperson. Officials said that no one was injured in the fire which was extinguished in half an hour. The reason behind the fire is to be ascertained.

228.title: Mob attacks police, torches vehicle after woman dies in accident in WB
228.article_body: A police team was allegedly attacked by a mob after a woman died in an accident at Digha-Nandakumar national highway in West Bengal's Daisai town. They also set a vehicle on fire and vandalised the police car. The woman died on the spot after a passenger pick-up van that she was travelling in collided with a dumper truck on Friday.

229.title: 4 sexual assault cases against Kochi tattoo artist after 18-yr-old alleges rape
229.article_body: Days after an 18-year-old girl, in a social media post, alleged she was raped in a popular tattoo studio in Kerala's Kochi, police registered four sexual assault cases against the tattoo artist. Kochi Police Commissioner said four women came forward to register formal complaints after enough persuasion. "We have some clues about the accused. He'll be arrested soon," he added.

230.title: Don't let Putin turn Ukraine into Syria: Ukrainian Foreign Min to NATO
230.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba attended a meeting of NATO Foreign Ministers on Friday and urged the military alliance to act now before it's "too late". "Don't let Putin turn Ukraine into Syria," he said.  "We are ready to fight. We will continue fighting, but we need partners to help us with concrete, resolute and swift actions, now," he added.

231.title: Drone movement detected along IB in Raj, J&K in separate incidents
231.article_body: BSF has opened fire at two drones along International Border (IB) in Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar and Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Arnia in separate incidents. Drone movement was detected in Sri Ganganagar between Friday and Saturday, while in Arnia it was around 4.10am on Saturday. Earlier, J&K police seized an arms cache allegedly dropped by a Pakistani drone in Treva.

232.title: Death toll from blast at illegal firecracker unit in Bihar rises to 14; SHO suspended
232.article_body: The death toll from the explosion at a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur has reached 14. Police suspect that the occupants of the house were illegally manufacturing firecrackers. Bhagalpur SSP said a Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the case. Tatarpur SHO has been suspended on charges of dereliction of duty.

233.title: Haryana introduces Bill to stop 'forcible' conversions amid protests
233.article_body: Haryana government on Friday introduced the Prevention of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Bill, 2022 in the Legislative Assembly amid protests from the Opposition. A Congress MLA tore a copy of the Bill after it was introduced by state Home Minister Anil Vij. "The Bill does not discriminate against any religion...meant to prevent only 'forcible conversions'," CM Manohar Lal Khattar said.

234.title: Private schools in Chandigarh allowed 8% fee hike for 2022-23 session
234.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has allowed private unaided schools in the UT to impose an 8% hike in the upcoming 2022-2023 session. "Private schools must not raise their fees this year as well," Chandigarh Parents' Association said. Earlier, in June 2020, the administration had directed private unaided schools to charge only tuition fees and not increase fees for the 2020-2021 session.

235.title: We are too critical of Kohli, he was in absolute control: Gambhir
235.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's 45 in the first innings of India's opening Test against Sri Lanka, Gautam Gambhir said we are "too critical" of Kohli at times, adding that he was in "absolute control" before being dismissed. "Even if he plays one bad shot, we say lapse in concentration," stated Gambhir. Kohli was dismissed by Lasith Embuldeniya.

236.title: Russian soldiers raping women in occupied cities: Ukraine
236.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said Russian soldiers are raping women in occupied cities. "When bombs fall on your cities, when soldiers rape women in occupied cities...it's difficult of course to speak about efficiency of international law," he added. "Russia, as a country that committed an act of aggression, will be held accountable for its deeds," he further said.

237.title: Thousands left without internet after cyberattack in Europe
237.article_body: Thousands of European users have been left without internet after a cyberattack reportedly took place at the start of Russia's invasion in Ukraine. According to Orange, nearly 9,000 subscribers of its service in France are without internet after a "cyber event" on February 24 at US satellite operator Viasat. French Space Commander General Michel Friedling confirmed the cyberattack on Viasat.

238.title: Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil, gas output: Tesla CEO Musk
238.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to discuss the need to increase oil and gas output, saying, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately." He acknowledged the move would "negatively affect Tesla", however, he further said, "Sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil & gas exports."

239.title: Russia's 4th richest person's ₹543 crore superyacht seized by Italy
239.article_body: Italian authorities have detained the superyacht of Russian billionaire Alexey Mordashov, who was recently sanctioned by European Union, in the coastal city of Imperia. The 56-year-old Chairman of Russian steel industry firm Severstal is Russia's fourth richest person with a $20.1 billion fortune, as per Bloomberg. His 215-foot yacht named 'Lady M' is worth €65 million (₹543 crore).

240.title: Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' earns ₹100 crore worldwide
240.article_body: Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark worldwide in the first week of its release. The film has earned ₹108.3 crore so far at the worldwide box office, Bhansali Productions shared on Friday. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial has earned ₹68.93 crore in India so far.

241.title: No idea what’s going on in Pant's head but he is a must watch: Vaughan
241.article_body: Terming Rishabh Pant as the "greatest" modern day entertainer, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted he has no idea what's going on in Pant's head but he is always a must watch. "I don't want to miss a ball he faces," added Vaughan in his tweet. Pant scored 96 runs in the first innings of India's Mohali Test against Sri Lanka.

242.title: Fight erupts between students over hijab issue at Mangaluru college
242.article_body: Two complaints were filed after a fight erupted between a group of male students and female students over hijab issue on Friday at a college in Karnataka's Mangaluru. A day before, five hijab-wearing students weren't allowed to give their exams after a few students objected and when the former returned the next day the fight erupted, a police official said.

243.title: He once was an enemy on the pitch, became a great friend off it: Vaughan on Warne
243.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan, while condoling Shane Warne's demise, said that Warne once was his enemy on the pitch, but became a great friend off it. "Shane was the greatest ever cricketer but more than that his character lit up every dressing room, commentary box, bar, golf club and friendship group," he added.

244.title: Taliban praises wheat sent by India, says 'Pakistan gave rotten, inedible wheat'
244.article_body: The Taliban has criticised Pakistan for donating poor quality wheat to Afghanistan as it praised the quality of wheat sent by India. "Wheat donated by Pakistan is rotten and inedible," a Taliban official said. Last month, India sent 50 trucks stacked with around 2,500 tons of wheat to Afghanistan to help relieve food shortages.

245.title: 3,200 ganja laced chocolates seized in Bengaluru, 2 arrested
245.article_body: The Mahadevapura Police arrested two people who hailed from Odisha on Friday for being involved in the supply of ganja laced chocolates to Bengaluru. The police seized 3,200 such chocolates weighing 18 kg. On Wednesday, the Bengaluru's Railway Protection Force (RPF) had seized 7.1 kg of ganja worth ₹4,26,000 at Banaswadi Railway Station under its operation NARCOS.

246.title: Shooting stones block Jammu-Srinagar National Highway
246.article_body: After being blocked on Thursday due to the landslides, the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway was blocked again on Saturday, this time due to shooting stones. The J&K Traffic Police said that the highway has been blocked at Panthyal and vehicular movement will be suspended until the clearance work completes. The highway connects Kashmir with the rest of India.

247.title: Greenlight to bombing: Zelenskyy on NATO rejecting no-fly zone request
247.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned NATO's decision to rule out the implementation of a no-fly zone over his country. "Knowing that new strikes and casualties are inevitable, NATO deliberately decided not to close the sky over Ukraine," Zelenskyy said. With this decision, the alliance has given Russia "the green light to the bombing of Ukrainian cities and villages", he added.

248.title: Supreme Court stays Delhi HC order allowing citizens to feed stray dogs
248.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday stayed a Delhi High Court order permitting citizens to feed stray dogs in every residential society. Pointing out its 2015 decision, the SC issued notice on a petition filed by an animal welfare society. The 2015 decision prohibits High Courts from passing orders pertaining to dogs under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960.

249.title: Households in Secunderabad Cantonment to get free drinking water
249.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) announced the extension of its free drinking water supply scheme to areas under Secunderabad Cantonment Board. Free drinking water up to 20 kilolitres per month will be provided to every household in the cantonment. The Telangana government has sanctioned a budget of ₹16.8 crore per year on account of the scheme.

250.title: Ukraine spends $15 mn of $50-mn crypto donation on military gear
250.article_body: The Ukrainian government has already spent $15 million of the donations it received in cryptocurrencies on military supplies, including bulletproof vests. The Crypto Fund of Ukraine had raised $50 million in crypto in a week to support Ukraine. The government aims to double the $50 million donated so far in the next two or three days.

251.title: Absorb Ukraine-returned medical students in Indian colleges: TS Singh Deo
251.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has written a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya expressing concern about the "further education" of the Ukraine-returned medical students. Deo has requested the Centre to absorb them in Indian medical colleges since there is uncertainty about when normalcy will return back to war-hit Ukraine.

252.title: Madurai govt officials to walk, use buses on Wed to curb pollution
252.article_body: According to a circular issued by Tamil Nadu's Madurai District Collector S Aneesh Sekhar, government officials in the district have been told to use buses or walk to offices on Wednesdays every week. It has been done in an effort to control air pollution in the district. This comes following a similar circular issued by Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board.

253.title: Putin signs law introducing jail for 'fake news' on army; CNN, BBC suspend operations
253.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed into law a bill introducing jail terms of up to 15 years for "fake news" about the Russian army. The bill sets out jail terms of varying lengths and fines against people who publish "knowingly false information". Following the news, BBC, Bloomberg and CNN announced that they will temporarily halt operations in the country.

254.title: Shane Warne rightly predicted India-England 2011 World Cup match to be a tie
254.article_body: Before India-England 2011 World Cup match on February 27, 2011, Shane Warne put out a tweet predicting the match would end in a tie. Warne's prediction came true when England scored 338/8 in reply to India's 338, and he was termed a 'genius' by then England captain Andrew Strauss. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

255.title: WB govt fixes cab fare limit, issues new norms for app aggregators
255.article_body: The West Bengal Transport Department issued new norms to regulate mobile application-based cab services to control surcharges on the cab fares. This comes after the state government received several complaints about increased cab fares. The government has fixed per kilometre fare for an AC taxi at ₹18.75 and the base fare of AC taxis has been fixed at ₹36.5.

256.title: Russia blocks Facebook, restricts access to Twitter
256.article_body: Russian media regulator Roskomnadzor has blocked Facebook in the country, claiming it found 26 cases of "discrimination against Russian media" by Facebook since October 2020. "Soon millions of ordinary Russians will find themselves cut off from reliable information...and silenced from speaking out," Meta's Global Affairs President Nick Clegg said. Russia also restricted access to Twitter.

257.title: He gave me my nickname: Ricky Ponting on Shane Warne's demise
257.article_body: Condoling Shane Warne's demise, Ricky Ponting tweeted, "Hard to put this into words. I first met him when I was 15 at...Academy. He gave me my nickname." He added, "We were teammates for [over] a decade...riding all the highs and lows together." Ponting's liking for dog races and betting on them had prompted Warne to give him the nickname 'Punter'.

258.title: I'm grateful to have known him: Hugh Jackman mourns Shane Warne's demise
258.article_body: Actor Hugh Jackman in an Instagram post expressed grief over the demise of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who passed away on Friday in Thailand. "I'm in shock to wake to the news that Shane Warne has passed away...I'm grateful to have known him, and to have witnessed his once in a generation talent," Hugh wrote, adding, "Rest well Shane."

259.title: He's stuck in Ukraine: T'gana woman who rode 1,400 km to bring back son during lockdown
259.article_body: The Telangana woman who covered nearly 1,400 km on a scooter over three days to bring home her son after he got stuck in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore due to nationwide lockdown in 2020 has said that he is now stuck in Ukraine. Razia Begum's son Nizamuddin Aman is an MBBS first year student in Ukraine's Sumy.

260.title: India reports 5,921 COVID-19 cases, 289 deaths in last 24 hours
260.article_body: India has reported 5,921 new COVID-19 cases and 289 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,396 cases and 201 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 63,878, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,14,878.

261.title: Our first Royal: Rajasthan Royals pen note on Shane Warne after his death
261.article_body: Rajasthan Royals took to Twitter to pen a note on Shane Warne following his demise, writing, "Shane Warne. The name stands for magic. Our first Royal; a man who made us believe that impossible is just a myth." "A mentor who turned everything he touched into gold," Rajasthan Royals added. Rajasthan Royals won IPL 2008 under Warne's captaincy.

262.title: Dismissed policeman destroyed evidence in Antilia bomb scare case: Court
262.article_body: The dismissed Mumbai Police officer Riyazuddin Kazi destroyed evidence in the Antilia bomb scare case, an NIA court said while denying him bail. This was done "with an ulterior motive to screen real offenders", it stated. Kazi had knowledge of the conspiracy hatched for placing explosives near Mukesh Ambani's residence and was following orders of Sachin Waze, the court added.

263.title: Assassinating Putin is not the position of US govt: White House
263.article_body: After US Senator Lindsey Graham called for the assassination of Russian President Vladimir Putin, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "That's not the position of the US government." "We're not advocating for killing the leader of a foreign country or regime change," Psaki added. Graham had called for "somebody in Russia" to assassinate Putin to end the Ukraine war.

264.title: Players shouldn't forget that int'l cricket got them into IPL: Elgar
264.article_body: South Africa Test skipper Dean Elgar said players shouldn't forget that performances for the national team resulted in them earning opportunities to play in the IPL, and not the other way around. IPL 2022 starts on March 26 with Kagiso Rabada, Quinton De Kock among the players set to feature. IPL 2022 will overlap with Bangladesh's tour of South Africa.

265.title: The world is a hard place for Vihari in many ways: Dinesh Karthik
265.article_body: Talking about Hanuma Vihari, Dinesh Karthik said the world is in "many ways" a "hard place" right now for Vihari, as he is batting at the number three position and knows he has limited time. "He is playing one format," added Karthik. Vihari scored 58 runs in the first innings of Team India's opening Test against Sri Lanka.

266.title: Civil engineer posing as policeman sexually harasses 13-yr-old Pune girl
266.article_body: Police have arrested a civil engineering graduate for sexually harassing a 13-year-old girl in Pune by posing as a police officer. The 22-year-old accused was booked along with two minor boys, both aged 13, who put him in touch with the girl. Police said the man was harassing the girl based on a video he had obtained from the boys.

267.title: Thank you for being so bloody good to me: Shane Watson on Shane Warne
267.article_body: Mourning the demise of Australian spin legend Shane Warne, former all-rounder Shane Watson tweeted, “I am numb!!! My hero, my mentor, my great friend, Shane Warne is no longer with us.” He added, “Warnie, the impact you had on this great game and everyone around it is immeasurable. Thank you for being so bloody good to me.”

268.title: Activision CEO Bobby Kotick to leave Coca-Cola board after 10 yrs
268.article_body: Activision Blizzard CEO Bobby Kotick will be stepping down from Coca-Cola's board after 10 years to focus his full attention on Activision's pending acquisition by Microsoft. Kotick informed Coca-Cola he will not stand for reelection to the board. Microsoft's $68.7-billion acquisition of Activision, which is its biggest deal ever, will create the world's third-largest gaming company by revenue.

269.title: Randeep Hooda discharged from hospital post knee surgery
269.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda has been discharged from Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai post his knee surgery. In a video, the actor was seen making his way out of the hospital with the help of a walker. Randeep suffered the injury last month while performing one of the scenes on the sets of the upcoming web series 'Inspector Avinash'.

270.title: KTR inaugurates four-lane road under bridge at Tukaram Gate in Secunderabad
270.article_body: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated the road under bridge (RuB) at Tukaram Gate in Secunderabad on Friday. The four-lane road is expected to ease traffic congestion on the Malkajgiri, Marredpally, Tarnaka, Mettuguda and Lalapet-Secunderabad roads. It will also provide relief from the frequent closure of railway line crossing at the Lalaguda Station.

271.title: Trump yet to use Truth Social weeks after its launch: Report
271.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has not added a single post to his social media platform Truth Social, since he launched it weeks ago, Axios reported. The only post on Trump's account is from its beta trial earlier, saying, "Get Ready! Your favourite President will see you soon!" Trump had announced he was creating his own social-media app last year.

272.title: Massive fire breaks out at hospital in Srinagar, patients rescued
272.article_body: A massive fire broke out in Bone and Joint Hospital in Barzulla area of Srinagar district on Friday. According to reports, the fire started at around 9:30 pm, following which several fire tenders rushed to the spot. "There is no loss of life. All patients have been evacuated safely," said Aijaz Asad, Deputy Commissioner, Srinagar.

273.title: Woman attempts self-immolation at Ludhiana police station over police inaction
273.article_body: A woman tried to immolate herself at Division 3 police station in Ludhiana over alleged police inaction on Thursday. She claimed she had been visiting the police station to file an FIR against her two sons and their wives for beating her and her husband up in public but no action was taken. Police, later, filed complaint against the accused.

274.title: Man brandishes sword in public, attacks & threatens police in Pune
274.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested after he allegedly brandished a sword near a public toilet and then attacked and threatened police officers when they tried to stop him in Pune's Warje. The accused has a history of seven-eight cases against him including body offences, robbery and house theft, a police sub-inspector said. The incident took place on Thursday.

275.title: 2 brothers stabbed in Delhi's Mangolpuri over argument, 4 held
275.article_body: Delhi Police apprehended four people, including a juvenile, for allegedly stabbing two brothers following an argument in the Mangolpuri area. A heated argument broke out between the two sides when the victims were going home after closing their shop, and the accused attacked them with a knife and screwdriver, police said. An attempt to murder case has been lodged.

276.title: Polling underway for 22 seats in 2nd phase of Manipur Assembly elections
276.article_body: Voting for the second and last phase of Manipur Assembly elections began at 7 am on Saturday. Altogether 92 candidates across 22 Assembly constituencies are in the fray. A total of 8.38 lakh voters are eligible to cast their votes. Voting will take place till 4 pm. The last one hour will be reserved for COVID-19 patients.

277.title: Could end in full-fledged war: NATO rejects Ukraine's no-fly zone pleas
277.article_body: NATO on Friday rejected pleas from Ukraine to impose a no-fly zone to halt Russia's bombing. "The only way to implement a no-fly zone is to send NATO fighter planes into Ukraine's airspace, and then impose that no-fly zone by shooting down Russian planes...If we did that...[it] could end in a full-fledged war in Europe," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said.

278.title: K'taka Budget allocates ₹8,409 cr for development works in B'luru
278.article_body: Karnataka government has allocated ₹8,409 crore for development works in Bengaluru in its Budget for 2022-23 ahead of the city's civic body's polls. This allocation is higher than the previous fiscal year, which was ₹7,795 crore. Of the total allocation, ₹6,000 crore has been set aside for providing basic infrastructure to the city over three years under 'Amruth Nagaroththana' scheme.

279.title: Samsung stops shipping products to Russia, will donate $6 million to Ukraine
279.article_body: Samsung Electronics has suspended shipments of its products to Russia "due to the current geopolitical developments". The South Korean tech giant had the largest share of 30% in Russia's smartphone market in the fourth quarter of 2021, Reuters reported. Samsung is also donating $6 million, including $1 million in consumer electronics, to support humanitarian efforts around the Ukraine region.

280.title: Russian forces are now 32 km from Ukraine's 2nd largest nuclear facility: US
280.article_body: US Ambassador to UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield has said, "Russian forces are now 32 km, and closing, from Ukraine's second largest nuclear facility." She said this after Russia attacked Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "We narrowly avoided a disaster last night. The international community must be unanimous in demanding Russia's forces stop their dangerous assault," she added.

281.title: Friends performed CPR on Shane Warne for 20 minutes to try to save him: Police
281.article_body: Police on the Thai island of Koh Samui said that Shane Warne was staying with four friends in his villa. The police added that the friends performed CPR on Warne for 20 minutes to try to revive him. The police further said that there was no sign of intrusion or possessions being searched through at his room.

282.title: Fire breaks out at Mumbai's Dreams mall, 2nd such incident in a year
282.article_body: A major fire broke out at Mumbai's Dreams Mall located in Bhandup area on Friday. However, no casualties or injuries were reported as the mall was closed during the time of the incident. A similar fire incident occurred here nearly a year ago when the mall was being used as COVID-19 ward during which reportedly 11 people lost their lives.

283.title: Ed Sheeran mourns Shane Warne's demise, recalls last conversation with him
283.article_body: Mourning Shane Warne's demise, Ed Sheeran wrote on Instagram, "Shane was the kindest heart, and always went above and beyond to make people feel welcome and special." Recalling his last conversation with Warne, Sheeran wrote, "I spoke to Shane on the anniversary of [Michael Gudinski's] passing this week…saying we were both raising a glass of 707 in his honour."

284.title: He loved you Jaddu: Harsha Bhogle to Jadeja after Warne's demise
284.article_body: Reacting to Ravindra Jadeja's condolence message for Shane Warne on Twitter, commentator Harsha Bhogle wrote, "He loved you Jaddu." Bhogle added, "Remember the time in '08 at DY Patil Stadium...He called you over and said to me 'This kid is a rockstar'." "Yes Harsha bhai, I still remember that chat. Really sad news," Jadeja responded.

285.title: World must not watch, but help: Ukraine amid war
285.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted, "The world must not watch, but help." "Nuclear terrorism requires decisive action in response. At the #UN Security Council meeting, we called for closing the sky over Ukraine," he added. Zelenskyy's tweet came after attack on Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine.

286.title: Warne shared pic from his villa hours before his death, wrote 'Goodnight from Koh Samui'
286.article_body: Hours before his death, Australian spin legend Shane Warne had shared a picture from his villa in Thailand on Instagram Stories and wished his followers a good night. He had written, “Goodnight from Koh Samui.” Warne passed away aged 52 due to a suspected heart attack. A week ago, he had expressed his desire to become England head coach.

287.title: Businessman robbed by 5, including police constable in Delhi
287.article_body: A businessman was allegedly robbed by five persons, including a police constable, in Delhi. The constable, who was earlier involved in a gang-rape and attempt to murder cases, is absconding, police said. "The incident took place on February 28 when (businessman) came out from his hotel...was held hostage by two men," police added. The other four accused have been arrested.

288.title: 20-yr-old newly married woman raped by brother-in-law in Greater Noida
288.article_body: A 20-year-old newly married woman was allegedly raped by her brother-in-law in Greater Noida, police said. The woman alleged that her mother-in-law was on the terrace when her brother-in-law overpowered her soon after her husband left home for work on Thursday. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter and trying to find the suspect, who's on the run.

289.title: Skywalk linking New Delhi Railway Station & metro station opens for public
289.article_body: DMRC has announced that the 242-metre skywalk between New Delhi Railway Station and its adjacent metro station has been opened for public use from today. DMRC said the skywalk connects the Ajmeri Gate side of the railway station with New Delhi Metro Station on Yellow Line and Airport Express Line. The skywalk also connects with multilevel parking across Bhavbhuti Marg.

290.title: Want to name baby after Operation Ganga: Indian man as pregnant wife rescued from Ukraine
290.article_body: A man from Kerala named Abhijit, along with his 9-month pregnant wife, was trapped in Kyiv in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war when he managed to move to safety with the help of the Indian embassy staff under Operation Ganga. He later reached Poland safely. "I've decided to name my...baby...Ganga after the name of...rescue operation that India launched," he stated.

291.title: Apple's corporate staff to start returning to offices from April 11
291.article_body: Apple's corporate employees will start returning to offices from April 11, the company's CEO Tim Cook told employees in an email. Employees will be required to work from office at least one day per week by that date, Cook said. He added that employees will need to be in the office at least three days a week from May 23.

292.title: Chhattisgarh journalist arrested over satirical articles on Cong MLAs
292.article_body: A journalist, Nilesh Sharma, was arrested by the cyber cell of Raipur Police for allegedly writing satirical articles with fictional characters resembling ministers and MLAs of ruling Congress. "We have registered the FIR as Sharma was writing baseless articles spreading misinformation and rumours," a police officer said. The complainant is reportedly close to Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel.

293.title: Ukraine still has majority of its air combat power: US official
293.article_body: A US defence official on Friday said, "The Ukrainians still have a significant majority of their air combat power available to them, both fixed-wing and rotary-wing as well as unmanned systems and surface-to-air systems." The Ukrainian military has suffered some losses, including aircraft destroyed by Russian forces, the official added. However, the official did not give any details.

294.title: Immediately cease all hostilities: German Chancellor Scholz to Putin
294.article_body: German government spokesman Steffen Hebestreit said Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Friday urged Russian President Vladimir Putin in an hour-long call to "immediately cease all hostilities and to allow humanitarian access to the embattled areas". French officials said President Emmanuel Macron spoke with Putin a day earlier. Hebestreit added that Scholz and Putin agreed to hold further talks soon.

295.title: Akshay Kumar, Ajay Devgn condole Shane Warne's demise
295.article_body: Bollywood actors took to social media to express condolences on the demise of legendary cricketer Shane Warne. "You could not have loved the game of cricket without being in complete awe of the man. This is so heartbreaking," wrote Akshay Kumar. "Still trying to grapple with the news of Shane Warne's sudden demise. RIP Shane," said Ajay Devgn.

296.title: Left millions in shock, disbelief: Anil Kapoor on Warne's demise
296.article_body: Celebrities and film actors mourned the demise of former cricketer Shane Warne and posted their condolence messages on social media. "This news has left millions like me in shock and disbelief...gone too soon...May you rest in peace king of spin," wrote Anil Kapoor. "Absolutely stunned! You take a piece of every 90s kid with you," said Vikrant Massey.

297.title: Mexican President says his country will not send arms to Ukraine
297.article_body: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Friday said the country will not send arms to Ukraine. "We don't send guns anywhere. We are pacifists," Obrador said. Ukrainian representatives on Thursday sent a letter to the Mexican Senate saying that "only the military and massive support of our allies can help us push back the enemy."

298.title: NIA chargesheets 5 for smuggling arms, narcotics via drones
298.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday filed a charge sheet against five persons who "smuggled illegal consignments of arms, ammunition, explosives and narcotics" across the border via drones. According to NIA, these illegal consignments were sent by absconding accused Lakhbir Singh Rode. "Incriminating evidence has been found against all the charge-sheeted accused," the agency added.

299.title: Putin denies bombing Ukrainian cities, says 'air strikes reports are fake'
299.article_body: In a phone call with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Friday, Russian President Vladimir Putin denied that Russian troops were bombing Ukrainian cities. According to Kremlin, Putin said reports about "the alleged ongoing air strikes of Kyiv and other large cities are gross propaganda fakes". He added that dialogue on Ukraine would be possible only if Russian demands are met.

300.title: In numbers: Australian spin legend Shane Warne's career
300.article_body: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne made his international debut in 1992 and retired in 2007. He took 1,001 wickets in 339 international matches. He was the first bowler to reach 600 and 700 Test wickets. Warne took 96 Test wickets in 2005, most by a bowler in a calendar year. He holds the record for taking most wickets in Ashes (195).

301.title: Death toll from blast at mosque in Pak's Peshawar rises to 56
301.article_body: The death toll from the suicide bomb blast at a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday rose to 56, according to police and hospital officials. At least 194 people were injured, many of whom were in critical condition. The suicide bomber had strapped a powerful explosive device to his body, packed with five kilograms of explosives, a police official said.

302.title: Entries funded by Russian government barred at Emmys 2022
302.article_body: The National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences (NATAS) has decided to disqualify entries funded by the Russian government for Emmys 2022 amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "NATAS has been appalled by Russia's...unprovoked attack on the sovereign territory of Ukraine," a statement by the NATAS chairman said. "Our members feel...deep kinship...for all the Ukrainian people," it added.

303.title: Railways shares video of 2 trains on same track avoiding collision with 'Kavach'
303.article_body: The Ministry of Railways on Friday shared a video of a successful test of the indigenously developed anti-collision system, 'Kavach'. The clip featuring Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw showed two trains approaching each other on the same track and automatically coming to a halt to avoid a collision. 'Kavach' is being promoted as the world's cheapest automatic train collision protection system.

304.title: This is the definition of wrong: Tim Allen on Russia-Ukraine conflict
304.article_body: American actor and comedian Tim Allen has said the ongoing Russian military operation in Ukraine is the "definition of wrong". "My mind and body are full of anger and disgust at the coward Putin ghouls that have attacked a sovereign country," Tim wrote on Twitter. "My head, heart and soul pray for the people of Ukraine," he added.

305.title: I want a family with you: Britney in birthday note for fiancé
305.article_body: Pop singer Britney Spears on Friday penned a note for her fiancé Sam Asghari on his birthday. "I love you so much...I want a family with you...I want it all with you," she wrote in an Instagram post. Sam commented on Britney's post and wrote, "Millions of things to wish for. I only have one wish."

306.title: Russia's neighbours should not escalate tensions: President Putin
306.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday urged Russia's neighbours to not escalate tensions amid Russia-Ukraine war. "There are no bad intentions towards our neighbours," said Putin. Putin also advised the neighbouring countries to not introduce restrictions against Russia. This comes eight days after Putin launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine killing 331 civilians including 19 children.

307.title: Happy with the way Poland helped Indian students: Jamnagar royal
307.article_body: Shatrushalyasinhji Jadeja, the patriarch of the royal family of the former princely state of Nawanagar-Jamnagar, has thanked the Poland government and the country's people for helping in the evacuation of Indian students stuck in war-hit Ukraine. Jadeja's father Maharaja Jamsaheb Digvijaysinhji had hosted nearly 1,000 Polish children, mostly orphans, as they sought to escape World War II.

308.title: My wife has all qualities except loyalty: Sam on Poonam Pandey
308.article_body: After being accused of domestic violence, producer Sam Bombay has said his wife Poonam Pandey "has all the qualities except loyalty". "Assault comes in various forms...Whatever happened between us, I wasn't the one who initiated [it]," Sam added. He said both of them loved each other but won't patch up because they have their own egos.

309.title: PM made Kashmir 'crown of India' after revoking Article 370: Shah
309.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a rally in UP's Ghazipur on Friday, said that PM Narendra Modi made Kashmir the "crown of India" following the revocation of Article 370. Further alleging that Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav had said there will be a "bloodbath" following the move, Shah claimed, "Nobody even pelted a pebble, let alone a bloodbath".

310.title: It's my resolution that every poor should have their own house: PM
310.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing an election rally in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur on Friday, said that it is his "resolution that every poor should have their own house". He further said, "They (Samajwadi Party) have built only 800 houses for the poor in Mirzapur, but in the last five years our government has built 28,000 houses for people of Mirzapur."

311.title: Ukraine will likely see more deaths, suffering, destruction: NATO
311.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Friday warned conflict in Ukraine will likely see "more deaths, more suffering and more destruction" as Russian troops attempt to gain control. "We call on President Vladimir Putin to stop this war immediately..." said Stoltenberg. Meanwhile, 331 civilians including 19 children have been killed in Ukraine since Russian invasion on February 24.

312.title: Sanctioned Russian billionaire barred from his European firm's offices
312.article_body: Mikhail Fridman, Russian Co-founder of Luxembourg-based investment group LetterOne, has been barred from entering the company's office buildings or speaking to its employees after the European Union (EU) imposed sanctions on him. LetterOne also said that billionaire Fridman and Russian banker Petr Aven have stepped down from the company's board and their assets in the business have been frozen.

313.title: Sonowal announces ₹100 cr investment for AYUSH sector in Nagaland
313.article_body: An investment of over ₹100 crore will be made towards the development of the AYUSH Healthcare sector in Nagaland, Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal announced on Friday. The allocated funds are to be used to develop a 30-bedded dedicated hospital and three 10-bedded hospitals. A state-of-the-art ayurvedic college will also be developed at Longleng at an estimated cost of ₹70 crore.

314.title: Aus woman wins ₹56 lakh lottery, days after mistaking official's calls as spam
314.article_body: An Australian woman won a lottery of A$100,000 (around ₹56 lakh), days after she ignored various phone calls assuming they were spam. The woman, who had purchased the lottery ticket on February 25, received phones calls and emails from a lottery official, which she ignored thinking they were a "scam". She found out about the lottery through her lottery account.

315.title: Legends live on: Shilpa as she pays tribute to Shane Warne
315.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Friday paid tribute to former Australian cricketer Shane Warne on his demise. "Legends live on," Shilpa wrote in the caption of her Instagram post along with a heart emoticon. Shilpa was a co-owner of IPL team Rajasthan Royals, which won the title in the inaugural year under the captaincy of Shane Warne.

316.title: Entire world passing through a delicate period now: PM Modi
316.article_body: Addressing an election rally in UP's Mirzapur, PM Narendra Modi said, "The entire world now is passing through a 'najuk daur' (delicate period) of this century." "Many countries are today affected by epidemic, disturbance and uncertainty," he added. Irrespective of how deep the crisis is, India's response is even bigger, he further said.

317.title: Ukraine tells people to add news about Ukraine in Google reviews for Russian eateries
317.article_body: Ukraine released a video instructing people, how they can add news about Ukraine in Google reviews for Russian restaurants. "Detailed instructions on how to "reach" the Russians, breaking through the information blockade of the Russian Federation," it tweeted. The video states that after selecting any Russian restaurant on Google Maps, people can post news or pictures of destruction in Ukraine.

318.title: An absolute legend and champion of our game has left us: Rohit on Warne's demise
318.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma mourned the demise of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne. "I'm truly lost for words here, this is extremely sad," he wrote on Twitter. "An absolute legend and champion of our game has left us. RIP Shane Warne...still can't believe it," Rohit further said. Warne died due to suspected heart attack.

319.title: Akhilesh cares for one community, one caste: Shah at UP poll rally
319.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav only cares for "one community and one caste". Addressing an election rally in UP, Shah said Akhilesh only sees people of one community "which we are not part of". "We are building homes for poor on the lands which were once occupied by the mafia," Shah added.

320.title: Life is so fickle and unpredictable, I cannot process it: Kohli on Warne's demise
320.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli took to social media to mourn the demise of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne. "Life is so fickle and unpredictable. I cannot process the passing of this great of our sport and also a person I got to know off the field. RIP #goat. Greatest to turn the cricket ball," he wrote.

321.title: I got ₹1,200 a day for first show, lower than junior staff: Ronit
321.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy has said he was offered ₹1,200 per day for his first TV show whereas his driver informed him that junior artistes received ₹1,500. "At that time, I needed to get back to work, I needed to say yes," Ronit said. "I am glad that I did that as it translated into more work," he added.

322.title: Centre constitutes Swadesh Darshan Awards, invites entries
322.article_body: The Union Ministry of Tourism on Thursday constituted Swadesh Darshan Awards in different categories. The ministry has decided to invite entries under categories like Best Tourist Interpretation Centre, Best Log Hut Facility, Best Cafeteria, etc. The awards aim at recognising efforts undertaken in the tourism sector by state governments, Union Territory administrations and implementation agencies.

323.title: Meesho aiming for IPO in 2023, considering India, US listing: Report
323.article_body: Bengaluru-based social commerce platform Meesho is aiming to go public in early 2023 and is evaluating both Indian and US exchanges, reported Reuters. "Meesho...wants to essentially be done with IPO (initial public offering) by the first half of 2023," Reuters quoted a source as saying. Founded by Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal, Meesho counts Meta and SoftBank as its investors.

324.title: Priest arrested after Dalit woman stopped from entering MP temple
324.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a priest for allegedly preventing a 31-year-old Dalit woman from entering a temple on Tuesday. The priest and two other women, who are currently absconding, had allegedly abused the complainant and told her she wasn't allowed as a special Patidar community pooja was going on. A video of the incident went viral on social media.

325.title: AC tram catches fire in Kolkata due to glitches, none injured
325.article_body: An air-conditioned tram with passengers caught fire on Friday while it was moving through Kolkata's Beniapukur area, the police said. No one was injured in the incident. The fire broke around 1 pm due to some technical glitches. "One fire tender was pressed into service, which brought the blaze under control," a police officer said.

326.title: Russia's private airline S7 to suspend all flights abroad from Mar 5
326.article_body: Russia's biggest private airline, S7 on Friday announced suspension of all international flights starting Saturday, March 5. This comes as US, UK and European Union are set to shut their airspace to Russian flights from next week as part of punitive measures after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Meanwhile, another Russian airline, Smartavia suspended all international flights from today.

327.title: Over 90% of US population in areas where masks are not needed: CDC
327.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Thursday said around 93% of the US population live in counties where COVID-19 levels are low enough that wearing masks indoors is no longer required. When the CDC eased its COVID-19 guidelines last week, around 72% of the population lived in areas experiencing low or medium levels of COVID-19.

328.title: Buses being operated from Ukraine to evacuate Indians: Centre
328.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs said on Friday that five buses are being operated to evacuate Indians from Kharkiv and Pisochin in eastern Ukraine. Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "900-1000 Indians [are] stranded in Pisochin and over 700 in Sumy." He said the Indian government had requested Ukrainian authorities to arrange special trains but it's yet to get a response.

329.title: KCR meets J'khand CM in Ranchi, says no anti-BJP front formed yet
329.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao met Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren at the latter's residence in Ranchi on Friday. Addressing reporters, KCR said, "We're clear...efforts should be made to take India in a new direction." Further speaking on the formation of an anti-BJP front, he added, "People are talking about a third front, a fourth front...no front has been formed yet."

330.title: ICC team going to Ukraine to probe war crimes: ICC Prosecutor
330.article_body: The International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan said a team set off for Ukraine on Thursday to investigate potential war crimes committed during Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Khan said they will look for evidence of war crimes, acts of genocide and crimes against humanity by all parties involved. The ICC has 123 member states.

331.title: You always had a special place for India: Sachin Tendulkar after Shane Warne's demise
331.article_body: Following the demise of ex-Australia cricketer Shane Warne, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Shocked, stunned & miserable...Will miss you Warnie. There was never a dull moment with you around...on or off the field." He added, "Will always treasure our on field duels & off field banter. You always had a special place for India & Indians had a special place for you."

332.title: What is Kavach, Made-in-India system to prevent collision of trains?
332.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday reviewed 'Kavach', an indigenously developed anti-collision system. Being promoted as the world's cheapest automatic train collision protection system, it is a set of electronic devices installed in locomotives as well as the tracks to bring a train to a halt automatically if it notices another train on the same track within a prescribed distance.

333.title: Magician with the ball: Irfan Pathan on Shane Warne’s demise
333.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Irfan Pathan on Friday condoled the demise of former Australian leg-spinner Shane Warne on Twitter, saying, "Shane Warne was a crowd puller. Magician with the ball. Absolute legend of Australian cricket. First IPL winning captain. He will be missed, He will be remembered forever." Warne died aged 52 of a suspected heart attack.

334.title: Balakrishnan re-elected as Kerala CPI(M) state secy for 3rd time
334.article_body: CPI(M) leader Kodiyeri Balakrishnan was on Friday re-elected as the party's state secretary in Kerala for the third consecutive time. He told reporters that CM Pinarayi Vijayan had suggested his name for the post, adding, "The party's state committee has expressed confidence in me for...third time". The state conference also elected an 88-member state committee and a 17-member state secretariat.

335.title: K'taka HC quashes FIR against Dream11 Co-founders over online gambling law
335.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has quashed an FIR filed by the state police against Dream11 Co-founders Harsh Jain and Bhavit Sheth for allegedly violating Karnataka's ban on online gambling last year. The development comes after the court struck down provisions of the Karnataka Police (Amendment) Act, 2021, which prohibited and criminalised online gambling and betting, calling them unconstitutional.

336.title: 331 civilians including 19 children killed, 675 hurt in Ukraine: UN
336.article_body: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Friday said 331 civilians including 19 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24. The office added 675 others were injured so far. As per OHCHR, most of the civilians were killed by heavy artillery shelling, multi-launch rocket systems, missiles and air strikes.

337.title: Italian PM condemns Russian attack on Ukrainian nuclear plant
337.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi on Friday condemned Russia's attack on the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine, calling the incident an "attack on everyone's security". Draghi's office added in a statement, "The European Union must continue to react united and with the utmost firmness, together with its allies, to support Ukraine and protect European citizens."

338.title: Rajasthan govt to hold 'Braj Holi Mahotsav' from March 12 to 14
338.article_body: A three-day festival 'Braj Holi Mahotsav' will be organised in Bharatpur, Deeg and Kaman cities of Rajasthan from March 12 to 14. "The east of Rajasthan is imbued with the essence of Braj and the...festival...is a celebration of the rich traditions,” said Nishant Jain, Director, Department of Tourism, Rajasthan. "It is set to enthral visitors of all ages," he added.

339.title: Paralysed man kidnapped in MP's Jabalpur, ₹15 lakh ransom sought
339.article_body: A 25-year-old man suffering from paralysis has been kidnapped by unidentified men in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district, the police said on Friday. The victim has been identified as Rahul Singh. An unidentified caller demanded ₹15 lakh from Rahul's family for his release, said Inspector NR Sinha. Rahul had gone to a local market on Wednesday but did not return home.

340.title: In pics: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne
340.article_body: A photo gallery shows moments from late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's life. Regarded as 'King of Spin', his international career spanned 15 years and saw him take 708 Test wickets and a total of 1,001 international wickets. Warne passed away at the age of 52 due to suspected heart attack in Thailand.

341.title: World no. 1 Ashleigh Barty withdraws from Indian Wells, Miami events
341.article_body: World number one Ashleigh Barty on Thursday said she will miss the upcoming WTA 1000 events in Indian Wells and Miami due to fitness issues. "I don't believe I am at the level necessary to win these events and as a result I have decided to withdraw from both tournaments," she said. Barty, 25, won the Australian Open in January.

342.title: India's new envoy Pradeep Kumar Rawat arrives in China
342.article_body: India's new Ambassador to China Pradeep Kumar Rawat has arrived in the country and is currently undergoing mandatory quarantine, the Indian Embassy in Beijing said on Friday. Rawat succeeds Ambassador Vikram Misri, who was appointed as Deputy National Security Advisor. Rawat's previous tenure in Beijing began in 2003 as Counsellor and ended in 2007 as Deputy Chief of Mission.

343.title: Russian athletes to leave Beijing, will not appeal Paralympics ban
343.article_body: The Russian Paralympic Committee (RPC) on Friday said its contingent in Beijing will leave China after being banned from competing following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding it will not appeal the decision. The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Thursday banned Russian and Belarusian athletes from participating in the Games after initially allowing them to compete as neutral athletes.

344.title: BJP will always keeps its promises no matter what the cost: Rajnath
344.article_body: Speaking at an election rally in Jaunpur, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said that the BJP never breaks the trust of people and fulfils promises it makes no matter what the cost. Notably, he also said that individuals from BJP may be unable to fulfil their promises. Singh claimed BJP will win around 300 seats in UP Assembly polls.

345.title: Cheating case accused escapes from police custody in Chandigarh
345.article_body: An accused in a cheating case escaped from police custody at the Sector 8 market in Chandigarh on Thursday. The man has been identified as Himanshu Kakkria. The police later recovered a pistol from his Toyota Fortuner parked in the market. "He managed to flee with his wife and their acquaintance," said Naveen Pal, Station House Officer, Mattaur, Mohali.

346.title: Shane Warne produced 'ball of the century' with his 1st ever Ashes delivery
346.article_body: Legendary Australian spinner Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 of a suspected heart attack in Thailand, bowled a big leg-break as his first delivery in Ashes to clean bowl Mike Gatting on June 4, 1993. The flighted delivery drifted in, then dipped and eventually hit Gatting's off-stump with sharp turn and is popularly known as "ball of the century".

347.title: Former world no. 1 Murray to renew Ivan Lendl as coach for a 3rd stint
