347.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray is set to renew his relationship with eight-time Grand Slam winner Ivan Lendl as his coach for a third stint together. They first worked together from 2011 to 2014, then from 2016 to 2017. Their partnership between 2012 and 2016 led to Murray winning three Grand Slam titles and two consecutive Olympic gold medals.

348.title: Murray receives wild card into ATP Masters 1000 event in Indian Wells
348.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray has been given a wild card entry into the upcoming ATP Masters 1000 event, the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. Murray previously reached the final of the tournament in 2009, where he lost to Rafael Nadal. Murray was beaten by Alexander Zverev 6-4, 7-6(4) in the third round of the tournament last year.

349.title: Russian lawmakers pass bill imposing jail for fake news about army
349.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Friday passed a bill imposing jail term of up to 15 years for intentionally spreading fake news about country's armed forces. This comes as Russian officials have repeatedly accused US and European allies of spreading false information against Russia. The law will be enforced only after the bill is signed by President Vladimir Putin.

350.title: Ukraine, Japan discuss Russian attack at Ukrainian nuclear plant site
350.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday informed Japanese PM Fumio Kishida about Russia's "nuclear terrorism" at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant. "We both agree on the gravity of threats to global security," Zelenskyy said. He also shared details of blaze at the nuclear plant site with Kishida. Earlier, a fire broke out at Europe's biggest nuclear plant due to Russian shelling.

351.title: He was always magical on the field: Raina on Shane Warne’s death
351.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Suresh Raina condoled the death of former Australian spinner Shane Warne on Twitter, saying, "At loss of words to hear the demise of our cricketing legend Shane Warne, he was always magical on the field. May peace be with you. My heartfelt condolences to his family and loved ones." Warne died of a suspected heart attack.

352.title: RIP my hero, totally shattered: Harbhajan on Shane Warne's death
352.article_body: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh on Friday condoled the demise of Shane Warne, who passed away due to a suspected heart attack. "Nooooooooooooooo can't believe you are no more Shane Warne," tweeted Harbhajan. "RIP my HERO...don't wanna believe this...totally shattered," he added. Warne died at the age of 52.

353.title: Microsoft suspends sales of products & services in Russia
353.article_body:
Microsoft on Friday announced that it was suspending new sales of its products and services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Microsoft added that it will proactively work to help 
cybersecurity officials in Ukraine defend against Russian attacks. "We stand with Ukraine in calling for the restoration of peace, respect for Ukraine’s sovereignty," the company added.

354.title: Nation will remain indebted to him: PM on demise of ex-Army chief
354.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday condoled the demise of former Army chief SF Rodrigues and tweeted that the "nation will remain indebted to him for his exceptional service and contribution towards making India stronger". He added, "He was respected for his deep strategic knowledge. My thoughts are with his family and friends." Rodrigues passed away at the age of 88.

355.title: SP only party to raise issue of unemployment in UP: Mulayam
355.article_body: Samajwadi Party patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav on Friday claimed that it was only the SP party that raised the issue of unemployment in Uttar Pradesh, adding that the party would provide employment opportunities to youth if it forms the government in the state. He said, "The party has always worked for poor, youth, uneducated and the ignored sections of society."

356.title: 'Goal by July is to get back in shape': Shane Warne in his last Instagram post
356.article_body: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, who passed away in Thailand, had shared a post on Instagram four days ago revealing his plan to get in shape by July. Sharing a throwback picture, he had written, "Operation shred has started (10 days in) and...goal by July is to get back to this shape from a few years ago! Let’s go."

357.title: No words to describe how shocked I am: Shoaib Akhtar on Shane Warne's death
357.article_body: Former Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to condole the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who died on Friday in Thailand. Sharing his picture, Akhtar wrote, "Just heard the devastating news about legendary Shane Warne passing away. No words to describe how shocked & sad I am. What a legend. What a man. What a cricketer."

358.title: Ex-Army Chief General Sunith Francis Rodrigues passes away at 88
358.article_body: General (retd) Sunith Francis Rodrigues, who headed the Indian Army between 1990 and 1993, passed away at the age of 88 on Friday. "Known as a Thinker and Strategist, he leaves behind a legacy of utmost dedication and service to the Nation," an official statement said. Rodrigues had also served as the Governor of Punjab between 2004 and 2010.

359.title: The man who made spin cool is no more: Sehwag on Shane Warne's demise
359.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag condoled the death of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, saying, "Cannot believe it. One of the greatest spinners, the man who made spin cool, superstar Shane Warne is no more." He added, "Life is very fragile, but this is very difficult to fathom. My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends and fans around the world."

360.title: Shane Warne condoled ex-Aus keeper Rod Marsh's demise in last tweet hours before death
360.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Shane Warne had condoled the demise of former Australian keeper Rod Marsh in his last tweet hours before his death. "Rod cared deeply about cricket & gave so much-especially to Australia & England players. Sending lots & lots of love to Ros & the family. RIP mate," he wrote. Warne passed away aged 52.

361.title: Israel can be potential ally if Palestinian conflict resolved: Saudi
361.article_body: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman has said, "We look at Israel as a potential ally but before that it should solve its problems with the Palestinians." Separately, he also said that Saudi Arabia intends to continue "detailed talks" with Iran in order to reach a satisfactory agreement for both. Saudi Arabia doesn't have diplomatic ties with Israel and Iran.

362.title: What weapons are being used by Russia in war with Ukraine?
362.article_body: Russian military has used warplanes, tanks, howitzers, Kalibr cruise missiles and Iskander missiles, which have a range of up to 500km, in Ukraine, according to AP. Ukrainian officials have accused Russia of using cluster bombs, rockets and artillery shells, which release "bomblets" that hit multiple targets. Ukraine also accused Russia of using thermobaric bombs that can vaporise targets.

363.title: Former Australia cricketer Shane Warne passes away aged 52 due to suspected heart attack
363.article_body: Former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne has passed away at the age of 52. Warne's management released a statement, saying that he passed away in Thailand due to a suspected heart attack. “Warne was found unresponsive in his villa and despite the best efforts of medical staff, he could not be revived,” the statement read.

364.title: Video shows PM playing 'damru' at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in UP
364.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday was seen playing a 'damru' at the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, a video of which has surfaced. He also offered prayers at the temple. Earlier in the day, PM Modi held a roadshow in Varanasi ahead of the last phase of Assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh on March 7.

365.title: Couple gets married in Ukraine's bomb shelter amid Russian invasion
365.article_body: A couple in Ukraine tied the knot in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion of the country. A video of their ceremony showed the bride holding a bouquet of flowers while a guest held a traditional Ukrainian wedding bread. The couple also signed marriage documents while a group of people cheered around them.

366.title: Morphed pic claiming Salman married Sonakshi goes viral, actress says 'Are you so dumb?'
366.article_body: A morphed picture claiming to show actors Salman Khan and Sonakshi Sinha secretly getting married went viral recently. The actress, while reacting to it, called out people believing the picture to be genuine. "Are you so dumb that you can't tell the difference between a real and a morphed picture?????" she commented on an Instagram post along with laughing emojis.

367.title: Hyd Police to conduct 'Gender Equality run' to mark Women's Day
367.article_body: Hyderabad Police's She Team will be conducting a 'Gender Equality 2K & 5K Run' to celebrate International Women's Day. The event will be held at People's Plaza, Necklace Road in Hyderabad on Sunday from 5.30 am. Those who sign up for the event will be entitled to a t-shirt, finisher medal and post-run breakfast as part of the registration fee.

368.title: Shahid Kapoor buys newly launched Mercedes-Maybach S-Class worth ₹2.5 crore, pics surface
368.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has purchased the newly-launched Mercedes-Maybach S 580, pictures of which have surfaced online. He bought the car for ₹2.5 crore, said reports. Pictures of Shahid and his wife Mira Kapoor along with the car had surfaced on social media. Shahid reportedly purchased the new car as a 41st birthday present for himself.

369.title: Reassuring to see over 20,000 Indians have left Ukraine: Govt
369.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Friday informed that over 20,000 Indians have left war-hit Ukraine since advisories were issued. "There are more people, but it's reassuring to see that these many people have left Ukraine," spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. India launched Operation Ganga to bring back citizens stuck in Ukraine after Russia invaded its neighbour last week.

370.title: Govt defers DefExpo 2022 to be held in Guj over logistics problems
370.article_body: The Ministry of Defence said on Friday that the DefExpo 2022 which was scheduled to be held in Gujarat's Gandhinagar from March 10-14 has been postponed due to "logistics problems being experienced by participants". PM Narendra Modi was to inaugurate the event. Earlier, the ministry said that 973 exhibitors, including 121 foreign exhibitors from 63 countries, had registered.

371.title: Nawazuddin spoke of his struggling days, I felt I'm on right path: Surya
371.article_body: Actor Surya Sharma has said that when actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui told him about his struggling days, he realised that he is on the right path in his career. The actor added that he met Nawazuddin at an acting workshop during his own struggling days. Surya further said that he has learnt a lot from Nawazuddin.

372.title: In next 5yrs, India will be world's biggest film industry: Prabhas
372.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said that pan-India films have opened many doors, adding that in the next five years, India will be the biggest film industry in the world. "Hollywood has one language in which films are made and so is the case with Chinese or Korean films. But in India, we have films being made in several languages," Prabhas added.

373.title: Pak Prez Arif Alvi appears before court in 2014 PTV attack case
373.article_body: Pakistan President Arif Alvi on Friday appeared before an anti-terrorism court in the 2014 Pakistan Television Corporation and Parliament House attack case. Members of ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party were involved in the attack. Alvi, who filed an application to decline availing Presidential immunity, said, "I appeared before the court today as a common citizen and not as the President."

374.title: Will pay for his treatment in Ukraine: Govt on Harjot who was shot at in Kyiv
374.article_body: The government of India will be bearing expenses for Harjot Singh's medical treatment in Ukraine, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Friday. "We're trying to ascertain his medical status...Our embassy is...trying to reach out but facing trouble as it's a conflict zone," said MEA spokesperson. Singh was shot at in Kyiv on February 27.

375.title: Meghan sued by half-sister over alleged false, malicious statements
375.article_body: Meghan Markle is being sued by her half-sister Samantha over her interview with Oprah Winfrey for allegedly making "false and malicious statements". Samantha stated that Meghan falsely claimed she raised herself from poverty and worked low-paying jobs to make ends meet. The lawsuit further stated that Meghan misled the public about her father's absence from her wedding with Prince Harry.

376.title: Let us evacuate our people, urge you to have local ceasefire: India to Russia & Ukraine
376.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday urged Russia and Ukraine "to have a local ceasefire at least so that we can evacuate our people, students". MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said that evacuation looks difficult without a ceasefire. This comes as government launched 'Operation Ganga' to evacuate all Indian nationals from Ukraine amid war.

377.title: Fan holds AP Dhillon song-inspired poster for Virat Kohli, pic goes viral
377.article_body: A picture of a fan holding a poster, inspired by AP Dhillon's song 'Excuses', in the stands during the first day of India-Sri Lanka Test in Mohali went viral. The poster dedicated to Virat Kohli read, "Kehndi hundi si 100 banade (She used to say 'Score a hundred')." Kohli got out for 45 runs off 76 deliveries in first innings.

378.title: Researchers discover world's oldest-ever stegosaurus fossil in China
378.article_body: Researchers from China, UK discovered world's oldest-ever stegosaurus fossil in China. Named Bashanosaurus primitivus, it lived 168 million years ago suggesting stegosaurus might have originated in Asia. With a length of 2.8 metres, Bashanosaurus had armour plates which were thicker, narrower than other stegosaurs but similar to those of first armoured dinosaurs that are over 20 million years old.

379.title: Man arrested for committing burglaries, possessing drugs in Hyd
379.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a man on charges of illegal possession of narcotic substances and committing burglaries. They have seized 1.2 kg marijuana, 10 ml of hashish oil, cash and other valuables worth a total of ₹3 lakh from him. The accused, Ahmed Pasha, was earlier involved in 19 burglary cases in Hyderabad, Cyberabad and Rachakonda, the DCP said.

380.title: Global food practices cause 21-37% greenhouse gas emissions: Report
380.article_body: Centre for Science and Environment's annual report stated that global food practices of 7.8 billion people account for 21-37% greenhouse gas emissions every year. The report further noted emissions from food system alone will cause earth to heat above the target of 1.5 degree Celsius. The report was released by Bhupender Yadav, Minister for Environment, Forest & Climate Change.

381.title: Sending charter plane after death doesn't matter: Indian shot at in Ukraine
381.article_body: Indian national Harjot Singh who was shot at in war-hit Ukraine has sought evacuation to India, saying, "It doesn't matter if you send a charter (plane) after death." He added, "God has given me a second life, I want to live it." Singh, who is from Delhi, said he hasn't received any support from the Indian embassy in Ukraine yet.

382.title: Our forces won't participate in Russia-Ukraine war: Belarus Prez
382.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Friday said Belarusian armed forces were not taking part and would not take part in Russia's military operation in Ukraine. He added he had a long and detailed telephonic conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday. This comes as a senior Belarusian military official said it has strengthened its air defences along the border.

383.title: UN human rights body sets up panel to monitor human rights in Ukraine
383.article_body: UN Human Rights Council on Friday set up a three-member panel to monitor human rights in Ukraine amid war with Russia. The council voted 32-2 to pass a resolution that was presented by many Western countries with 13 member states including China abstained from voting. Meanwhile, as per UN, over 1 million refugees fled Ukraine in just seven days.

384.title: Netflix pauses future Russian projects amid conflict with Ukraine
384.article_body: Streaming service Netflix has paused all future projects and acquisitions with Russia due to its military operations in Ukraine. Netflix had four Russian original projects in the pipeline including a crime thriller series which was shooting and has been postponed. Earlier Disney and Warner Bros announced that they will be pausing all theatrical releases in Russia.

385.title: 'Namma Clinics' to be set up in all wards of Bengaluru: CM Bommai
385.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru. Bommai said the clinics, which are reportedly similar to Delhi's Mohalla Clinics, will be established in all wards of Bengaluru. The services of detection of non-communicable diseases and referral for higher treatment to specialists will be provided in these clinics.

386.title: Google Maps, Tripadvisor disable adding new reviews for Russian businesses
386.article_body: Google has blocked users from adding reviews on Maps for places in Russia, Ukraine and Belarus. Tripadvisor has also blocked reviews for restaurants and hotels where people had started posting comments on the Russia-Ukraine conflict as reviews. Hacking group Anonymous had earlier asked users to leave messages about the situation in Ukraine in Google Maps reviews for Russian businesses.

387.title: K'taka CM allocates ₹1,000 crore to implement Mekedatu project
387.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 today, announced that ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for the implementation of the Mekedatu project. He said the Mekedatu Balancing Reservoir and Bengaluru Drinking Water Project will be implemented by getting a nod from the centre. This comes after the Congress concluded its Mekedatu padayatra on Thursday in Bengaluru.

388.title: Meghalaya becomes 9th state to withdraw general consent to CBI
388.article_body: Meghalaya has become the ninth Indian state to withdraw general consent given to CBI. Notably, BJP is a partner in the ruling coalition, led by CM Conrad Sangma. Terming it a normal procedure, Sangma said, "Anybody who comes in here, has to take consent." Mizoram was the first state to withdraw consent in 2015 when it was ruled by Congress.

389.title: I'm not getting into movies: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan
389.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to hold an 'ask me anything' session. She later shared a story of her answers, one of which stated, "I'm not getting into movies." Ira has made her directorial debut in theatre. She helmed a play called 'Medea' in which the lead role was played by actress Hazel Keech.

390.title: Ex-German Chancellor Schroeder should resign from Russian firms: Scholz
390.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has called on former Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder to resign from his posts at Russian firms. Schroeder is said to be a long-time friend of Russian President Vladimir Putin and is currently the chairman of the supervisory board of the Russian state energy company Rosneft. Scholz added the ex-chancellor's ties with Russian companies were not private matters.

391.title: Ridiculous: Sunny on trolls saying she adopted daughter for publicity
391.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone has called the trolls who accused her of adopting her daughter for publicity ridiculous and childish. "I think that the person who wrote that is someone who is not a part of my daily life," the actress added. Sunny further said that 'grow up' is the thing she will say for the comments that were made.

392.title: African arrested at Mumbai airport for smuggling drugs worth ₹2 cr
392.article_body: A 43-year-old African citizen has been arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) for allegedly smuggling cocaine worth nearly ₹2.30 crore. Kaba Ibrahimaat was intercepted at the Mumbai airport by DRI officials following a tip-off. No drugs were found in his baggage, however, it later emerged that he had swallowed the contraband in pellet form.

393.title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee park to be built on 350-acre land in B'luru: Bommai
393.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced to set up an Atal Bihari Vajpayee park on a 350 acre land in the Jarakabande area of Bengaluru's Yelahanka to increase the city's green cover. The proposed park will be based on the model of Bengaluru's Lalbagh and Cubbon Park. Notably, Bommai has allocated ₹8,409 crore for Bengaluru's development.

394.title: Which nations supported Russia or abstained from UNHRC vote on Ukraine crisis?
394.article_body: The UN Human Rights Council has said it has decided to establish an independent commission of inquiry as a result of Russia's aggression against Ukraine after a vote. While Eritrea and Russian Federation voted against the formation of the commission, India, Armenia, Bolivia, Cameroon, China, Cuba, Gabon, Kazakhstan, Namibia, Pakistan, Sudan, Uzbekistan and Venezuela abstained from voting.

395.title: Russian lawmakers introduce jail terms for 'fake' news about military
395.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Friday passed legislation to impose fines and jail terms for spreading "fake" news about Russia's armed forces. The amendments have to be approved by Parliament's upper house before going to President Vladimir Putin to be signed into law. Russia's enemies have spread false information in an attempt to sow discord among Russian people, officials claimed.

396.title: Domestic help in Mumbai clicks indecent pics of minors, held
396.article_body: A 27-year-old domestic help in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly clicking pictures and videos of his employer's 13-year-old daughter and 11-year-old niece while they were changing clothes or bathing. According to police, the accused was caught after the 13-year-old came across the pictures while playing games on his phone. Police also found pictures of other minors on the device.

397.title: Fire at communications centre disrupts internet in Iran's capital
397.article_body: The Iranian Communications Ministry on Friday said that a fire at the main telecommunications building in Tehran disrupted internet services in Iran's capital and the nearby city of Karaj. The fire was caused by a malfunction in a power connection, it added. Notably, Iran has some of the strictest controls on internet access in the world.

398.title: Kareena, Alia don't shy away from any kind of cinema: Ananya
398.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has said that Kareena Kapoor and Alia Bhatt don't shy away from any kind of cinema, adding that they do a little bit of everything. "I don't think that there are any roles that they've done that...I could've done justice to," she added. Ananya further said that she is in awe of Kareena and Alia's off-screen personalities.

399.title: 'Grammys Global Spin' recognises Armaan Malik for his single 'You'
399.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has been recognised by the 'Grammys Global Spin', a concert series produced by the Recording Academy, for his single 'You'. The singer has become the first Indian artist to feature on the series. Initiated in 2020, the Global Spin showcases acts from around the world in order to promote global music.

400.title: We won't back down: Wikipedia as Russia threatens to block over invasion article
400.article_body: The Wikimedia Foundation said it will "not back down" after Russia threatened to block Wikipedia's Russian-language site covering Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia had claimed the article contained "illegally distributed information" about deaths among Ukrainian civilians and Russian forces that entered Ukraine. "We stand by our mission to deliver free knowledge to the world," Wikimedia added.

401.title: Mom saw Aashram, said 'Haye haye, you did such a role?': Bobby Deol
401.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has revealed that his mother watched his series 'Aashram' and said, "Haye haye, tune aisa role kiya (You did such a role)?" Bobby further said that his father veteran actor Dharmendra couldn't bring himself to watch the series and told him, "Beta, main tujhe aise nahi dekh sakta (Son, I can't watch you like this)."

402.title: Don't become slave to the system: Shaan warns young singers
402.article_body: Singer Shaan has urged young singers to "not become a slave to the system" by giving in to the industry pressure. "In the long run, you are destroying yourself as an artiste. No one will take you seriously," Shaan said. The singer added there is a 'new pressure' of garnering 'higher views' online, however, the singers shouldn't lose their identity.

403.title: Rishabh Pant misses ton by 4 runs as India score 357/6 on Day 1 against Sri Lanka
403.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant missed his century by four runs as India scored 357/6 on Day 1 of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali. The 24-year-old scored 96 runs off 97 deliveries, including nine fours and four sixes, and was dismissed by pacer Suranga Lakmal. Virat Kohli, who is playing his 100th Test, got out for 45(76).

404.title: Wait for official announcement: Maker of 'Mriya' reacts to video of its damage
404.article_body: Days after the world's largest aircraft 'Mriya' was destroyed by the Russian forces in Ukraine, its manufacturer, Antonov, responded to a viral video allegedly showing the damage sustained by 'Mriya'. It wrote, "Until the AN-225 has been inspected by experts, we cannot report on the technical condition of the aircraft. Please wait for the official announcements about its condition."
